Texts:
The farmer and his son soon found themselves standing next to the old red tractor, which had broken down years ago.  The tractor had been parked at the side of the laneway near the entrance to the field where the <color=red>dairy-cows</color=red> were grazing.  At the end of the field, on this side of the gate, stood two huge stacks of nice dry bales of <color=red>hay</color=red>.

The sun was shining and there was barely a cloud in the sky.  There was hardly a breeze and the sky was a deep, dazzling blue.  It was a quiet, warm and bright sunny day."

Go luath ina dhiaidh sin bhí an feirmeoir agus a mhac ag seasamh in aice leis an seantarracóir dearg, a bhriseadh cúpla bliain ó shin. Bhíodh an tarracóir páirceáilte ag taobh an bhóithrín gar de bhéal na páirce, áit a bhíodh na <color=red>bá-déiríochta</color=red> ag féarach. Ag deireadh na páirce, ag an taobh seo den gheata,bhíodh dhá <color=red>bhurla-féir</color=red>.

Bhí an ghrian ag taitneamh agus b’éigean aon scamaill sa spéir.  B’éigean aon ghaoth agus bhí an spéir mar ghorm trom ag lonrú.  Ba lá ciúin, teolaí, grianmhar é."
